name: Ninth Day Memorial
description:
Your friend has died and you have to time-travel in order to save them. Except you don't really want to. And something goes wrong in the process.
A sappy game about horrible people made simply to justify my purchase of a used physical copy of RPG Tkool 2000.

Features
  • plot loosely inspired by events that occurred to me during first half of 2022
  • can be finished in about five minutes
  • multiple endings that depend on both the right choices and RNG events but mostly choices
  • in-game achievements with crappy bonus artwork
Content warning

Even though this is definitely not a horror game, there are some sounds and visuals some players may find disturbing, plus there can also be an audio jumpscare at one point, so please play with caution.

Troubleshooting & Other Important Things

See readme.txt for more info.

For EasyRPG Player users and those who only have 3 MB of memory on their HDD: it is strongly recommended that you download and play the lite version of the game instead of the regular one.

For potential streamers: today I learned that a tiny portion of the game is now copyrighted (oof), so be wary of that while streaming/filming letsplays.
